pageContext.claim: “And a very big question is: What are we going to do with the power plant? Because the power plant has been wiped out. It’s not like, let’s go back and fix it. That's what I do; I’m a good construction guy. You don't go back and fix it; there is nothing.”
pageContext.analysis: "Hurricane Maria left the island's power plants largely intact, but the power lines have been wiped out. In the wake of Hurricane Maria, Puerto Rico's 3.4 million American citizens remain almost entirely without electrical power — but it's not because their power plants are blown," reports {The Verge.}
